Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<>>: $API <<>>: $CODE <<>>: $EXPLANATION. Question: Extract text from html file using java: :I am working on a text crawler and I need to extract a certain text from several sites. I have used jsoup html parser:Document doc = Jsoup.connect("http://www.aljazeera.net/programs/behindthenews/2014/11/9/%D8%A3%D8%B3%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%A8-%D9%88%D8%AF%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%85%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%AF%D8%A7%D9%85-%D8%A8%D8%AC%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D9%85%D8%B5%D8%B1").get();Elements ps = doc.select("p");String s = Jsoup.parse(ps.text()).text();PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter("newFile.txt", "UTF-8");out.write(s);out.close();This algorithm gets me an unwanted text, the wanted text is under this tag

And when I change my selection to Elements ps = doc.select("p dir=rtl");, it returns a compilation error.Is there any way to make it just select this wanted tag? Please using this api: PrintWriter.write. Answer:
response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<>>: $API <<>>: $CODE <<>>: $EXPLANATION. Question: Extract text from html file using java: :I am working on a text crawler and I need to extract a certain text from several sites. I have used jsoup html parser:Document doc = Jsoup.connect("http://www.aljazeera.net/programs/behindthenews/2014/11/9/%D8%A3%D8%B3%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%A8-%D9%88%D8%AF%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%85%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%AF%D8%A7%D9%85-%D8%A8%D8%AC%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D9%85%D8%B5%D8%B1").get();Elements ps = doc.select("p");String s = Jsoup.parse(ps.text()).text();PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter("newFile.txt", "UTF-8");out.write(s);out.close();This algorithm gets me an unwanted text, the wanted text is under this tag

And when I change my selection to Elements ps = doc.select("p dir=rtl");, it returns a compilation error.Is there any way to make it just select this wanted tag? Please using this api: PrintWriter.write. Answer: <<>>: Jsoup.select <<>>: Elements ps = doc.select("p[dir=rtl]"); <<>>: The Jsoup.select() method allows you to select elements based on CSS selectors. In this case, we're selecting all "p" elements that have a "dir" attribute equal to "rtl". ``` ## Code: ```java import org.jsoup.Jsoup; import org.jsoup.nodes.Document; import org.jsoup.select.Elements; import java.io.File; import java.io.FileWriter; import java.io.IOException; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { try { // Load the HTML file File input = new File("path/to/your/html/file.html"); Document doc = Jsoup.parse(input, "UTF-8", ""); // Select the elements with the desired tag and attribute Elements ps = doc.select("p[dir=rtl]"); // Write the text to a file FileWriter writer = new FileWriter("path/to/your/output/file.txt"); writer.write(ps.text()); writer.close(); } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } } } ``` Replace "path/to/your/html/file.html" and "path/to/your/output/file.txt" with the actual paths to your HTML file and the output file, respectively. This code will select all "p" elements with a "dir" attribute equal to "rtl" and write their text to the specified output file. <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|>
